Our focus areas encourage lifelong learn: Our focus areas encourage lifelong learning through flexible, inclusive and comprehensive initiatives that meet the changing need.
Cambodia's Skill Gap: Challenges and Opp: Cambodia's Skill Gap: Challenges and Opportunities in Lifelong Learning
Cambodia's strong economic growth, avera: Cambodia's strong economic growth, averaging 7.7% GDP increase over the past two decades, is threatened by a mismatch between education outputs and labor market needs, with 60% of employers struggling to find skilled workers. With 62.% of Cambodia lacking basic digital skills, enhancing digital literacy and lifelong learning is crucial for workforce participation and income growth, as additional education can increase earnings by 5-15%. The ILC emphasizes the importance of lifelong learning and the need for national lifelong learning for skill relevance, career development, and equity. To address these challenges, the National Commission of Lifelong Learning is hosting a forum to improve skills, promote social mobility, and foster collaboration among government, employers, workers, and training institutions.
The 1st National Forum on Lifelong Learn: The 1st National Forum on Lifelong Learning Cambodia

The 1st National Forum on Lifelong Learning Cambodia, held on March 28, 2024, at the Sun & Moon Riverside Hotel in Phnom Penh, was a significant event aimed at establishing a shared vision for developing the country's lifelong learning ecosystem. The forum was conducted in a hybrid model, allowing participants to join both online and onsite. This inclusive approach ensured that a wide range of stakeholders could participate and contribute to the discussions.
The forum brought together key figures f: The forum brought together key figures from various sectors, including H.E. Dr. Hang Chuon Naron, Minister of Education, Youth and Sport of Cambodia, who was a key speaker. The event emphasized the importance of multi-stakeholder dialogue and cooperation to ensure that digital-enabled lifelong learning reaches all Cambodians. This approach is crucial for supporting sustainable economic growth and preparing Cambodians with the necessary technical, digital, and human skills for success.

The NEC has an important role to play in: The NEC has an important role to play in encouraging ministries and relevant institutions to provide support and lifelong learning, for which member ministries include:
Our focus areas enhance lifelong learnin: Our focus areas enhance lifelong learning through flexible, inclusive, and comprehensive initiatives that meet the changing needs of individuals and communities
The Royal Government of Cambodia has dev: The Royal Government of Cambodia has developed a National Policy on Lifelong Learning, which was approved in 2019, with the aim of enhancing potential human resource development to achieve sustainable development goals. At the same time, the development of a National Action Plan on Lifelong Learning is necessary and requires the concerted efforts of all institutions and stakeholders, focusing on the quality and effectiveness of human resource development. This action plan is an incorporated mechanism within a common national goal that can broaden and make participation more effective in providing opportunities and services, as well as recognizing and responding to the needs of service recipients and the labor market, especially for marginalized group.
The National Policy on Lifelong Learning: The National Policy on Lifelong Learning aims to provide everyone with diverse educational opportunities and support so they can apply their skills and knowledge to enhance efficiency, quality, productivity, and income in the information technology era and smart society.

The National Policy on Lifelong Learning seeks to equip all Cambodians, at every stage of life and in every location, with the knowledge, skills, attitudes, physical fitness, and personal attributes necessary to foster economic growth and promote harmonious lives within families and communities.

menu_1.title: National Policy on Lifelong Learning
menu_1.goals_intro: To achieve the above vision and purpose, we have set the following goals:
menu_1.goal_1: Deliver lifelong-learning services to all Cambodians.
menu_1.goal_2: Offer diverse, flexible programs tailored to learners’ needs.
menu_1.goal_3: Establish accessible learning centers, infrastructure, and spaces.
menu_1.goal_4: Train and certify professional lifelong-learning coordinators.
menu_1.goal_5: Recognize, validate, and ensure the quality of lifelong learning achievements in accordance with the Cambodian National Qualifications Framework, in a transparent, fair, and consistent manner.
menu_1.goal_6: Mobilize ministries, institutions, the private sector, and development partners to support and implement lifelong learning.
menu_1.strategy_intro: The following key strategies will be implemented to meet our objectives and goals:
menu_1.strategy_2: Deliver lifelong-learning services to all citizens.
menu_1.strategy_3: Design diverse, flexible programs that respond to learner needs.
menu_1.strategy_4: Build accessible learning centers, infrastructure, and spaces.
menu_1.strategy_5: Train and certify professional lifelong-learning coordinators.
menu_1.strategy_6: Recognize, validate, and accredit lifelong learning in a fair, transparent, and consistent manner.
menu_1.strategy_7: Engage ministries and institutions in lifelong-learning support.
menu_1.strategy_8: Foster a culture of global citizenship.
menu_1.strategy_9: Promote equality, equity, gender equality, and inclusion.
menu_1.strategy_11: Engage the private sector, development partners, and non-governmental organizations to deliver lifelong-learning services.
menu_1.document_2: National Action Plan on Lifelong Learning 2024–2028

menu_2.title: About NCLLL
menu_2.subtitle: The National Committee for Lifelong Learning (NCLLL) is the coordinating body responsible for monitoring, supervising, evaluating, and supporting the Royal Government’s lifelong learning initiatives under the Education Law and the National Policy on Lifelong Learning.

section.rolesTitle: Roles and responsibilities of the NCLLL
section.rolesIntro: The National Committee for Lifelong Learning (NCLLL) serves as an advisory body to the Royal Government on implementing the National Policy on Lifelong Learning and has the following responsibilities:
section.compositionIntro: The National Committee for Lifelong Learning (NCLLL) comprises 30 member ministries and 1 General Secretariat, which oversees administrative and technical functions to ensure the sustainable operation of the NCLLL as follows:
section.emblemIntro: The NCLLL logo incorporates the following symbols and their meanings:

roles: Develop and disseminate the National Action Plan for Lifelong Learning.
Recommend to the Royal Government the preparation of legal frameworks, mechanisms, and necessary measures at the national and sub-national levels to support policy implementation.
Promote and coordinate the provision of non-formal and informal education services to all citizens, enabling literacy, numeracy, technical and vocational skills, and lifelong learning opportunities.
Organize and develop diverse and flexible lifelong learning programs.
Develop infrastructure, learning spaces, and learning centers.
Promote training and advance gender equality, equity, and inclusion.
Foster a culture of lifelong learning among citizens.
Coordinate and encourage ministries and institutions at national and sub-national levels to implement policies, strategies, and action plans for lifelong learning.
Encourage ministries, relevant institutions, the private sector, development partners, and NGOs to participate in providing and supporting lifelong learning services.
Propose to the Royal Government revisions to the policy and national action plan for lifelong learning.
Monitor, supervise, and evaluate the implementation of policies and action plans across ministries, institutions, and sub-national levels.
Report progress on implementing the National Policy and Action Plan to the Royal Government.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Royal Government.

emblemPoints.title: Three human figures (light green, dark green, sky blue) standing shoulder to shoulder, symbolizing the three stages of life:
children: Light green represents the early stage of life, growth, development and learning
Dark green represents the middle stage, maturity and solidarity
Sky blue represents the later stage, old age and wisdom.

emblemPoints.title: The circle of green romduol leaves surrounding the human figures symbolizes the natural resources that sustain life. As Cambodia’s national flower, romduol represents our nation’s wealth and support for the Khmer people.
The green book at the base, inscribed with “NCLLL” in sky-blue letters, represents the source of knowledge and wisdom and serves as the guiding teacher across all fields of learning.
